There are several ways that we got it.

One is that several suspects were held in Jordanian intelligence prison, and they've subsequently been released, but reported having been held in cells next to non-Jordanians who told them about the rendition that they went through.

So you would have a guy sitting in a cell and in the cell next to him, and they can yell through the hole in which their food is delivered or yell through the walls, they would tell their stories to each other and sometimes pass notes.
So we were able to interview several former Jordanian prisoners who were housed in prison next to non-Jordanians who had been rendered.
Another way was, and this was fascinating, the Jordanian authorities actually opened up their prison to Human Rights Watch so that they could show us how well the prisoners were being treated.

They, unfortunately for them, let us have - to interview the prisoners without minders, and a couple of the prisoners, who are actually still in prison, told us similar stories corroborating what the prisoners, former prisoners, on the outside had already told us.

And we were able to get some of these flight records, which included aircraft that were linked to the CIA, Gulf Stream jets, and Boeing 737s, that landed in Jordan on the same day that these prisoners had told us that these flights landed in Jordan, so that was another piece of corroborating evidence.
